str2: A particle of succession, then, moreover.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) an end, (b) event or issue, (c) the principal end, aim, purpose, (d) a tax.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
